intro: Enkianthus perulatus, commonly known as the Japanese enkianthus, is a deciduous shrub native to eastern Asia. It belongs to the family Ericaceae and is characterized by its showy, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows in moist, acidic soils and prefers partial shade, often found in forested areas. Its foliage consists of dark green, elliptical leaves that provide a striking contrast to its vibrant floral displays. Enkianthus perulatus is valued in horticulture for its ornamental appeal and ability to thrive in cooler climates.
